result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek George Briggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek George Briggs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek George Briggs was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek George Briggs

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Derek George Briggs in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Derek George Briggs.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will enter into amended DJOC in 21CF361. In 22CF45 state will amend count 1 to misdemeanor pursuant to 946.49(1)(a), Count 2 will be dismissed. State recommends 60 days stayed for one year probation, conditions of probation to include 1 days jail, 1 credit, DOC programming, $50 plus costs. 
DJOC in 21CF361 will be extended for one year and must comply with conditions in 22CF45. court will adopt amended DJOC in 21CF361.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads guilty. Cout informs defendant of rights given up by his plea. Defendant understands. Stipulation to a factual basis. Court accepts plea of guilty and finds defendants plea has been knowingly and voluntarily made, defendant understand all rights given up by his plea. Court finds defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered.
Court orders 60 days jail I&S for one year probation, 1 day jail, 1 credit, time served, $50 plus costs, DOC programming, 120 days to pay after bail applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:36 AM Defendant Derek George Briggs in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Derek George Briggs.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Finds case is close to resolution. State asks for a week or two. Court sets potential plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: 10:33 AM Defendant Derek George Briggs in court and not in-custody with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendants right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly, understandingly, and voluntarily made. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice.  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
02:59 PM Defendant Derek George Briggs in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls the case; 
Defendant states that the Public Defenders Office will appoint but not until next week
Defendant waives time limits; Court-matter is reset to March 9th; remove the preliminary hearing for tomorrow  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:33 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Derek George Briggs
Current: 1303 Poplar Avenue, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2022)
Prior: 509 21St Ave E, Superior, WI 54880
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

02:13 PM Defendant Derek George Briggs in court and not in-custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will file for PD. Court accepts not guilty plea.   Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance from yesterday. Defendent thought his appearance was next month. States request on bail: $250 cash bail. State indicates defendant is out on deferred in 21CF361 and there was no F.T.A.'s in that case.
Defendant requests signature bond as he doesn't have no money to post. Defendant is starting a new job on the 22nd. 
Court has concerns as there is a F.T.A. and a felony case with the inability to follow Court Orders. Court acknowledges defendant is here today. Court Orders $250 cash bail  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:12 PM Defendant Derek George Briggs not in court.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recites charges and penelties. State requests Warrant with Wisconsin and Minnestoa.
